intro: Paratropia macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked paratropia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a hairy texture. Paratropia macrostachya is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
